AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: conducted a vehicle stop as part of an investigation into human smuggling, operated the Freer immigration checkpoint, noticed drop-offs on Farm-to-Market Road 2050 to avoid checkpoints, monitors traffic on Farm-to-Market Road 2050 which is mostly used by ranchers and oil field workers, followed suspicious vehicles, recognizes vehicles associated with the wind farm on Farm-to-Market Road 2050, identified rental cars as commonly used by smugglers, observed a white Malibu sedan with suspicious behavior, stopped a vehicle transporting illegals, received a phone call regarding a traffic stop and arrived at the scene, transported an individual to the Freer immigration checkpoint for further questioning, conducted the initial traffic stop and had an agent present during interviews, interviewed IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. after he waived his rights, conducted a roving stop of RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR., governed by the standard articulated in reasonable suspicion cases, stopped vehicles near the United States-Mexico border, familiar with most of the ordinary traffic in a sparsely populated area like Farm-to-Market Road 2050
